author: Amadio Telesco
text: 'Had lattes and coffee  good people watching  coffee was excellent'

author: Gary Stout
text: "Possibly my favorite place on Earth. Amazing coffee
column5: perfect taste in music at all times and the staff has always been legendary. I've been coming here since they opened and have made a lot of friends mingling with people in here. The people that work here and have worked here in the past I've grown to know and became friends with over the years. Top notch ownership
column6: beautiful spaces that are well thought out with great details
column7: and just a great experience the second you step foot in any location. BWE is a vibe."

author: Ostap Kirichenko

author: Kate Tell

author: Ludmilla Perez
text: 'College kid/ ‚Äúwfh‚Äù heaven! Delicious food delicious coffee and you truly can‚Äôt beat the vibe. I would even bring the kiddos here on Saturday/ Sunday morning to read books and have breakfast. Overall they did an amazing job with creating a welcoming and friendly eco centric environment to have people gather in!'

author: Gabe Emtage
text: 'Great vibe and coffee! Awesome little cafe to check out.'

author: Rina Muqkurtaj
text: 'Pre-pandemic
column5: I loved this place. Great coffee. Great baristas. I‚Äôve been going here since I was in high school. They have a walk-up window now. Unfortunately
column6: they don‚Äôt require masks (of customers or staff) while the delta variant fuels COVID surges everywhere. I dropped by yesterday and it was packed full of maskless patrons. As much as I‚Äôll miss this place
column7: I‚Äôll have to refrain from visiting it for the time being. Attached: Photo from February 14

text: "Hands down the best coffee shop in Hoboken. A family run small business with oodles of style and substance. They support local with their showcase of products from other small businesses on sale
column5: not to mention their relentless philanthropy. Can't say enough good things about Bwe!"

author: Greg Merritt
text: "1 year later they don't let you in
column5: don't let you use the bathroom
column6: and treat their customers like spreaders. No thank you
column7: I'm not interested in the fear and paranoia. Selling coffee but no bathroom?? Hoboken is open! I can sit in other coffee shops and enjoy a cup as long as I want. This is nonsense."

author: Karen N
text: 'I really wanted to like this place but the $2.67 for a lukewarm ‚Äúregular‚Äù coffee with a kick of acidity is at most a one star experience (and that‚Äôs being generous). Ordered ahead using their website at 10:10am and it estimated a  10:30am time for ready for pick up
column5: got there at 10:15am and it was sitting by the pick up window...'

column5:
that's how I measure your coffeeness.
a) Is it on the menu?
b) Is it made well?
So

text: 'I was ordering a decaf latte when an Indian woman leaned over to the barista and said
column5: ‚ÄúI just needed to stop and tell you that your turmeric latte tasted exactly like my grandmother‚Äôs. I couldn‚Äôt believe it. Thank you.‚Äù I changed my order and am loving every sip of this golden treat as I type this. Also
column6: the baristas are great at what they do and their demeanor add to the laid back homey feeling of Bwe. This little caffeine heaven strikes the perfect balance of intriguing indie obscurity and the vibe of a warm hearth.'

author: Veronica Rojas
text: 'Decided to spend an afternoon in Hoboken and my husband had us stop by this cute coffee shop. We thought it was more of a cafe but it mostly has some baked goods and coffee or tea not sandwiches. This was fine with us as we always like people/places to focus on one thing and do it well. It has milk alternatives which is always a plus for me - almond
column5: soy
column6: and oat milk which is my favorite! The drinks are large sized 12 oz and 16 oz but the price is equivalent to an 8oz drink in NYC so  don‚Äôt mind if I do! ;) Has good amount of seating with a large table in the back of the shop for small groups or getting work done. Overall great coffee at a great cost with baked snacks. Would recommend!'

text: 'A very modern atmosphere. Friendly staff and pretty good coffee'

author: Ron G
text: 'Excellent coffee'

author: Miguel Alc√≥n (Mikel)
text: 'Best cortado in Hoboken'

author: S T
text: 'Great latte.'

author: David Orr
text: 'Good espresso and pastries. You can buy a chemex here and a reusable glass coffee cup.  Skip the plastic!'

author: Darren Scott
text: 'Best cafe experience in Hoboken. There are other spots to get good coffee in town but not as good for the full trendy
column5: (in a good way)
column6: cafe vibe.'

author: John Mikhail
text: "Love this place. Is always busy. Feels like a modern low key neighborhood coffee place that's pretty sophisticated. Get a good sense of the local crowd here. Good service."

author: Julian Taborda
text: 'Great coffee! Good spot for sitting and reading or getting some work done
column5: if you can get a seat though.  The interior is nicely decorated as well.'

author: Andrew Stinton
text:
'(Translated by Google) Mmmmm cut ...

(Original)
Mmmmm cortado...'

author: Steve K
text: "Great spot for a delicious coffee. Don't come here expecting a big breakfast though!"

author: zava226
text: 'Great local non-Starbucks coffee shop'

author: Sandra Ordonez
text: 'My favorite cafe shop in Hoboken
column5: New Jersey! The coffee is on point and the vibe is chill. Plus
column6: a portion of their proceeds go to Haiti relief efforts.'

author: Ernest Kirstein
text: 'Pretty good food
column5: pretty good atmosphere. Decent cup of coffee. I will be back.'

author: Eva Westphal
text: 'The best little cafe in Hoboken
column5: no competition! My friend and I always come here to enjoy an iced latte and do some homework. The atmosphere is kawaii
column6: the workers are pleasant and never seem distant from their customers and

author: Power Cleanouts Junk Removal
text: "A little expensive but definitely the best damn latte we have ever had in our lives. We even brought friends from out of town and bought them lattes. Our wallets lost a few ounces and our bank accounts a few zeros but we'd gladly loose them again for just another sip of that fine latte."

author: David Keene
text: 'Great friendly staff who know how to make coffee - hip clientele'

author: Waheed Rasheed
text: 'Good baristas and coffee'

author: David Patafio
text: 'great coffee. great place to study or spend an hour relaxing'

author: Wen Lui
text: "The coffee is from La Colombe and it's
column5: as usual
column6: great--robust and bold with just the right amount of kick. I've had an almond latte and a regular latte here and they were both delicious!\n\nIt's also a really nice spot to kick back and relax
column7: whether with a friend or alone with your computer/smart phone/book. There are smaller tables at the front
column8: and a huge communal table at the back. I personally prefer the front because there's a ton of natural light there
column9: which makes the place seem really warm and cozy. The baristas are also really friendly and welcoming. I'll definitely go back with a good book or my laptop soon!"

author: Sasha G
text: 'I am such a cafe feign.\nI seriously can\'t get enough of them.\nAnd I must say: bravo Hoboken! Despite the usual Hobo stroller moms
column5:
this cafe pretty much embodies everything I want in a cafe:

* great lighting and relaxing ambiance
* conveniently located near my lover's place
* great cause and background story (work in Haiti)
* an interesting name
* good espresso (La Colombe!)
* & ALMOND MILK. (enough said.)

Because we're both coffee feigns and the name "Bwe kafe" means "drink coffee" in Haitian Creole- we were instantly enticed. I mean there's nothing else really Haitian about this place being it's in Hoboken I don't think they want to shock their typical clientele but it's a great place nonetheless!

Perfect spot to spend the afternoon with my love sipping an iced almond milk latte
column6: giggling (yes
column7: men giggle) at the stroller moms and the frazzled look on their faces.\n\nI\'m hooked & I will totally return.'

author: Zocy K
text: 'Best espresso in the city (of New York as well)'

author: Peter Kim
text: "When I was looking into moving to uptown Hoboken
column5:
I was a bit concerned that all the good coffee shops were downtown. It sounds like Red Lion is good but doesn't have indoor seating.

I was glad to find out that bwe kafe was opening just after I moved in. I got a Haitain pour-over which was delicious. Also had a very good danish.

The inside space is really nice -- there are some small 2-person tables in the front area and a large 6-8 person table in the back. Free wi-fi for people who want to study or do work.

Looking forward to coming here often!"
